intro: Carica nana, commonly known as the dwarf papaya, is a small tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Caricaceae family and is closely related to the common papaya (Carica papaya). The plant typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters, with palmate leaves and yellow-orange flowers. Its fruit is similar to the common papaya but smaller, with a sweet, aromatic flavor. Carica nana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit in warm climates.
